The '''National Intelligence and Security Agency''' ('''NISA''') ({{lang-so|''Hay'ada Sirdoonka iyo Nabadsugida''}}) is the national [[intelligence agency]] of the [[Somalia|Federal Republic of Somalia]] is in-charge of secret service, intelligence and covert operations for the national interests of Somalia, The main objective of (NISA) is to collect the intelligence data through different means and to safeguard the national interests. The job is to identify and block the threats to the state and its citizens and to reinforce the country's security and safety according to the teachings of Islam and the constitution.
==Overview== NISA was officially reestablished in January 2013 by the new [[Federal Government of Somalia|Somali Federal Government]] in place of the defunct [[National Security Service (Somalia)|National Security Service]] (NSS).<ref name="Wsrinisa">{{cite news|title=Somalia Re-Opens its National Intelligence & Security Agency|url=http://www.waltainfo.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=6968:somalia-re-opens-its-national-intelligence-a-security-agency&catid=70:international-news&Itemid=309|accessdate=1 September 2013|newspaper=Walta Info|date=10 January 2013}}</ref><ref name="Asrracsttsniasa">{{cite web|title=PRESS RELEASE: AU Special Representative reaffirms AMISOM's continued support to the Somali National Intelligence and Security Agency (NISA)|url=http://www.newvision.co.ug/newvision_cms/newsimages/file/Janat/Press%20releases/AMISOM%20Press%20Release%2007-01-2013.pdf|publisher=African Union|accessdate=2 September 2013}}</ref> It is part of a broader effort by the federal authorities to re-establish state institutions.<ref name="Asrracsttsniasa"/>
Headquartered in [[Mogadishu]], NISA is tasked with firming up security.<ref name="Wsrinisa"/> It is assisted in this capacity by [[AMISOM]].<ref name="Asrracsttsniasa"/> According to the former Minister of State for the Presidency Abdulkadir Moallin Noor, the [[CIA]] also provided training to NISA officials during the latter agency's formative stages.<ref name="Acssfp">{{cite news|title=CIA using secret Somalia facility, prison: report|url=https://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5iCxftvYlAlWhXpR95VIPbI40PyKA?docId=CNG.c8ba8f0624a66c8deceb6923cf3cb470.21|accessdate=2 September 2013|newspaper=AFP|date=12 July 2011}}</ref>
NISA personnel have conducted security operations against [[Al-Shabaab (militant group)|Al-Shabaab]] elements in the capital.<ref name="Gsmsontasm">{{cite news|title=Somalia: Mogadishu security operation nets 27 Al Shabaab members|url=http://www.garoweonline.com/artman2/publish/Somalia_27/Somalia_Mogadishu_security_operation_nets_27_Al_Shabaab_members_printer.shtml|accessdate=2 September 2013|newspaper=Garowe Online|date=30 August 2013|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140720205321/http://www.garoweonline.com/artman2/publish/Somalia_27/Somalia_Mogadishu_security_operation_nets_27_Al_Shabaab_members_printer.shtml|archivedate=2014-07-20 | agency=Garowe Online}}</ref>
In April 2014, the United Arab Emirates donated several battle wagons and other equipment to NISA.<ref name="Uevtfos">{{cite news|title=UAE efforts vital to future of Somalia|url=http://www.pressreader.com/uae/the-national-news/20150522/281724088139382/TextView|accessdate=22 May 2015|agency=The National|date=22 May 2015}}</ref>
==Counterterrorism force== As of July 2014, the Gaashaan ("Shield") counterterrorism force constitutes a fundamental part of the National Intelligence and Security Agency.<ref name="Osclnctf">{{cite news|last1=Pugliese|first1=David|title=Somali-Canadian leads new counter-terrorism force|url=http://ottawacitizen.com/news/national/defence-watch/somali-canadian-leads-new-counter-terrorism-force|accessdate=22 July 2014|agency=Ottawa Citizen|date=20 July 2014}}</ref> According to Somali government officials, it is a commando force trained by the United States. NISA associates indicate that Gaashaan consists of two units totaling 120 men.<ref name="Utscfa">{{cite news|last1=Dan Joseph|first1=Harun Maruf|title=US-Trained Somali Commandos Fight Al-Shabab|url=http://www.voanews.com/content/us-trained-somali-commandos-fight-against-al-shabab/1968832.html|accessdate=1 August 2014|agency=VOA|date=31 July 2014}}</ref>
Alpha Group is Gaashan's first component, and includes around 40 soldiers and 3 officers who were chosen from amongst 190 special [[Somali Armed Forces|Somali National Army]] troops. According to Somali defense officials, this unit received training in the United States between late 2009 and early 2010. U.S. anti-terrorism expert Derek Gannon indicates that the Alpha Group's training regimen includes counter-insurgency, counter-terror operation and executive-protecting, with an emphasis on quick reaction in an urban environment. The soldiers are also equipped with guns with night-vision scopes, among other modern military hardware.<ref name="Utscfa"/>
Gaashaan's second counter-terrorism unit is the Bravo Group. It received training at the [[Aden Adde International Airport]] (Mogadishu Airport) in 2011.<ref name="Utscfa"/>
A third commando unit, [[Somali Armed Forces#Commandos and Special Forces|Danab]] ("Lightning"), is being trained within Somalia by U.S. security personnel separately from the Gaashaan counterterrorism force. It is modeled after the [[United States Army Rangers|U.S. Rangers]].<ref name="Utscfa"/>
